cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River (325 mi SE of Houma, Louisiana)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north and making landfall along the southeast Louisiana coast before moving inland into Mississippi and the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Grand Isle, just south of New Orleans

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (all former watch area upgraded to warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward into coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Major hurricane winds possible: sustained winds 100–120 mph with higher gusts likely around landfall; hurricane-force winds could reach metropolitan New Orleans.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 7–11 ft possible in Lake Pontchartrain and along the mouth of the Mississippi River; overtopping of levees outside the main protection system is possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches producing life-threatening flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado threat Sunday into Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents on approaches and in the lower Mississippi River channel.
